events.title: Peterloo Massacre
events.description: A peaceful pro-democracy rally in St Peter's Field, Manchester, was violently dispersed by cavalry, resulting in numerous deaths and injuries.
events.significance: The massacre highlighted the struggle for parliamentary reform in Britain and increased support for democratic movements.

events.title: Birth of Alexander Fleming
events.description: Alexander Fleming, the Scottish bacteriologist who discovered penicillin, was born.
events.significance: Fleming's discovery revolutionized medicine by introducing antibiotics, saving countless lives.

events.title: Death of Elvis Presley
events.description: Elvis Presley, the American singer and cultural icon known as 'The King of Rock and Roll,' died at his home in Graceland, Memphis.
events.significance: Presley's death marked the end of an era in music and had a profound impact on popular culture worldwide.

events.title: Pope John Paul I Dies
events.description: Pope John Paul I died after only 33 days as pope, one of the shortest papacies in history.
events.significance: His sudden death led to the election of Pope John Paul II and had lasting effects on the Catholic Church.
